segments.text: I see the woman polishing that plate like it's the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder why she doesn't just turn off the faucet and save herself the trouble.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the children, quietly working together to get those cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the boy is brave, balancing on that stool like a circus performer.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the girl, her eyes wide with excitement as she waits for her treat.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit envious of their teamwork and determination.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the water puddle growing larger, inching closer to the children.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman must have a lot on her mind to miss all this commotion.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the garden outside, so serene and untouched by the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's like a little haven, just beyond the reach of the kitchen's madness.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the children get their cookies and the woman finishes her dishes without any mishaps.
segments.speaker: PAR
